## registry.getObject() function

Gets the object for the given name and type.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function getObject<T>(type: string | Type<T>, name: string, opt_throwIfMissing?: boolean): T | null;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  type | string \| [Type](./blockly.registry_namespace.type_class.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt; | The type of the plugin. (e.g. Category) |
|  name | string | The plugin's name. (Ex. logic\_category) |
|  opt\_throwIfMissing | boolean | _(Optional)_ Whether or not to throw an error if we are unable to find the object. |

**Returns:**

T \| null

The object with the given name and type or null if none exists.
